data.title: What is Aqueous Vermiculite Dispersion?
data.meta_description: What is AVD? Find out how aqueous vermiculite dispersion works, what the benefitsare and why it’s an important component of your fire safety setup.
data.text:
AVD is applied in the form of a mist which is composed of fine droplets of water containing vermiculite platelets. When deposited on the surface of the burning fuel, the water suppresses the flames and cools the fuel source bringing the fire under control.

Lithium-ion battery fires burn at very high temperatures, often >1100°C. As the water cools and evaporates, the high aspect ratio vermiculite platelets overlap and bind together, producing a heat-resistant oxygen barrier between the fuel and the atmosphere is produced.

AVD is a novel extinguishing agent which has been specifically developed to tackle the unique risks of Lithium-ion battery fires.

A unique fire type requires a unique extinguishing agent and AVD has many excellent properties to bring Lithium-ion battery fires under control quickly limiting the potential damage and losses caused by the propagating fire.

AVD acts to suppress the flames, extinguishing the fire, and forms a heat and oxygen barrier of vermiculite as the water evaporates.

AVD is unique in its thermal resistance properties and can be applied as a fire break to prevent propagation of the fire to surrounding materials and property.

AVD Fire has conducted hundreds of Battery fire tests to develop AVD and offers a wide range of certified fire-fighting products including;

Portable fire extinguishers

Large-volume trolley units

Fire suppression kits,

Fire resistant containers

Fire blankets.

Furthermore, the versatile AVD extinguishing agent can be delivered using standard fire-fighting equipment and can be used in fixed systems designed for the risk at hand.

AVD Fire provides the best, most versatile solution to battery fires across a wide range of applications.
